meanings.definition: Reduce (something) to small particles or powder by crushing it.
meanings.sent1: I grind the coffee beans every morning for a fresh cup of coffee.
meanings.sent2: She used a mortar and pestle to grind the spices for the curry.
meanings.sent3: The blender can grind ice into a fine snow-like texture for smoothies.
meanings.sent4: The old millstone used to grind wheat into flour creaked with each turn.
meanings.sent5: The relentless waves grind the rocks along the shore into smooth pebbles over time.

meanings.definition: Sharpen, smooth, or produce by crushing or friction.
meanings.sent1: He would grind the axe against the sharpening stone until it was razor-sharp.
meanings.sent2: The skater had to grind the edges of her blades to remove nicks and imperfections.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter's sander can grind down rough edges to make them smooth.
meanings.sent4: The constant use of the pencil sharpener can grind the pencil down to a stub.
meanings.sent5: The constant friction can grind the metal gears of the machine to a halt if not lubricated regularly.

meanings.definition: Work hard over a period of time.
meanings.sent1: She had to grind through the night to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The students had to grind through their textbooks to prepare for the exam.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to grind through a busy dinner service without a break.
meanings.sent4: The athlete had to grind through intense training sessions to improve his performance.
meanings.sent5: The farmer had to grind through the harvest season to ensure all crops were collected in time.
